results.title: Selling solidarity = Australian unionism in the '90's
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
Australia has always had a strong union heritage. Peter Robson, (National President of the CPSU), and Peter Sams, (Secretary of the NSW Labour Council, discuss reasons for the rapidly declining membership and the ACTU’s multi-million dollar plan to recruit a new generation of workers.

results.title: Live & or let die
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
This lateline program examines the issues surrounding the legalisation of euthanasia. The first portion of the program looks at the situation in Holland where euthanasia is decriminalised. The second portion of the program is a panel discussion between 3 doctors who present a range of opinions on this topic. The video includes Teacher’s Notes. No other credits available.

results.title: Mabo myths
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
The High Court’s Mabo decision late in 1992 was probably the most significant legal decision ever made by an Australian Court. Sadly, it led to widespread scaremongering by sections of the community, the emergence of the ‘Mabo Myths’ and put Aboriginal spokespeople firmly on the back foot. Lateline carefully examines the myths related to the security of various types of land title in Australia and as one observor said, admirably clarifies the decision and its meaning for all Australians.

results.title: Diplomacy and deceit
results.creator_credit: Per-Eric Hawthorn, Peter Morgan and Independent Television News (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
Provides students with the inside story of how the Western powers failed to stop the conflict in the Balkans. Key political figures reveal what happened behind the scenes. It examines the continuing communist influence in what was once an Eastern Bloc country, the failure of diplomacy to end the conflict and the absence of Western military intervention.

results.title: Peege
results.creator_credit: Randal Kleiser, Leonard S. Berman, David Knapp, Phoenix Films and Bedford Productions
results.brief_description: A family visits their grandmother, who is in a nursing home, on Christmas Day. Peege, as they call their grandmother, is nearly blind and her mental and physical capacities are failing. Through a number of flashbacks the eldest grandson remembers her as she was when he was a child - full of vitality and laughter. When the others leave he talks to her of the old times, and breaks through her isolation. Cast includes Bruce Davison, Jeanette Nolan, William Shallert, Barry Livingston, David Alan Bailey, Barbara Rush.

results.title: Pee Wee's big adventure
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Richard Gilbert Abramson, Robert Shapiro, Aspen Film Society and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Pee Wee Herman’s Big Adventure is Tim Burton’s feature film direction debut. It is the surreal tale of Pee Wee Herman, the grown-up kid with impeccable dress sense, and his most prized possession, his awesome bicycle. When Pee Wee discovers it has been stolen from outside Chuck’s Bike-o-rama, he is devastated and embarks on the long journey to find it. He hits the open road and encounters riotous adventures with bikers, bums, cowboys, an escaped con man, a phantom trucker and a waitress who dreams of travelling to Paris. His quest leads him to the Warner Brothers studio in Hollywood where security is tight and Pee Wee’s bike is in the hands of a spoilt child star. He eventually manages to steal it back drawing the interest of a Hollywood producer who makes Pee Wee’s story into a James Bond send-up. The latter includes special appearances by James Brolin, who stars as P.W. Herman and Morgan Fairchild, his assistant and lover. Includes music by Danny Elfman. Cast includes: Pee Wee Herman, Elizabeth Daily, Mark Holton, Diane Salinger and Judd Omen.

results.title: Dirt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Trace Fraim, Michael Covert, Kirk Hassig, Trudi Callon and Canned Pictures
results.brief_description: Two daft Texan brothers, Scooter and Junior, are left bereft and domestically helpless when their dear old Ma dies. They hatch a plan to get a woman to replace her, searching strip bars, and even approaching a prostitute to fulfil the role. When these attempts fail they kidnap DeDe (Tara Chocol), who, due to the sadistic nature of her marriage, decides to stay with them. After DeDe’s husband, a Texas Ranger, burns their house down, the brothers rob banks to support the burgeoning family. Junior, who has emotional problems, falls for DeDe whilst Scooter forms an attraction to a bank teller, Margaret, at a local branch they frequent. “Dirt” is a black comedy and farce that apes the style and energy of a Coen brothers’ film (in particular Raising Arizona) but screenwriter, director and star Michael Covert fails to achieve the same distinctly outlandish tone. Despite some slyly inspired moments, and witty one-liners, Covert ultimately opts for conventional narrative outcomes over his subversive intentions. The film trots out a slew of familiar Texan movie cliches (bigoted and corrupt police, violent husbands, dim-witted simple folk) whilst amid all the darkly themed humour, it attempts to make some salient points about the futility of male violence. Also stars Tracy Fraim, Patrick Warburton and Olivia Rosewood.

results.title: Dinosaurs: the terrible lizards
results.creator_credit: Wah Chang and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Uses special effects and models to recreate the age of the dinosaurs. Gives an overview of what they looked like, what they ate, and how they lived and died. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: Dipping sheep
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance, at dipping time, of making a clean muster and dipping all sheep on the property. The importance of keeping sheep in the bath for a sufficient length of time and the necessity of following the manufacturer’s instructions when mixing the dip are also stressed. Various types of spray plants and plunge dips are shown.
